docs.abstract: FAO puts world crop at record 135 million tons; details on output and exports by countries; illus

headline.main: Global Rice Production Expected to Hit New Peak; RECORD EXPECTED FOR RICE OUTPUT Rise of 7% Above 1958 Level Foreseen This Year by United Nations Unit

byline.original: By KATHLEEN McLAUGHLINSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., July 13 -- The international wool market, tamed to the meekness of its own lambs by recession conditions since mid-1957, has begun to roar again. World prices reported to the statistical division of the United Nations have...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., July 13 -- The international wool market, tamed to the meekness of its own lambs by recession conditions since mid-1957, has begun to roar again. World prices reported to the statistical division of the United Nations have climbed steadily in each month of 1959 through April, with later but incomplete data implying an even steeper rise in May and June.
docs.abstract: UN comm repts world prices rising

headline.main: Article 14 -- No Title; U.N. Group Reports World Prices on the Rise U. N. FINDS PRICES OF WOOL ON RISE

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 13 -- The Council of the Organization of American States voted unanimously today to call together the foreign ministers of the twenty-one American republics. The meeting will deal with unrest in the Caribbean and the problems of...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 13 -- The Council of the Organization of American States voted unanimously today to call together the foreign ministers of the twenty-one American republics. The meeting will deal with unrest in the Caribbean and the problems of representative democracy and human rights throughout Latin America.

headline.main: HEMISPHERE TALK ON UNREST CALLED; Foreign Ministers to Meet on Caribbean Situation -Site to Be Decided HEMISPHERE TALK ON UNREST CALLED

docs.snippet: WEST GERMANY scheduled for release yesterday a 20-pfennigs violet, yellow and black stamp which the postal administration says illustrates the "Heligen Rocks" (Holy Tunic). The cathedral at Trier, Germany, claims to have the tunic -- Christ's...
docs.lead_paragraph: WEST GERMANY scheduled for release yesterday a 20-pfennigs violet, yellow and black stamp which the postal administration says illustrates the "Heligen Rocks" (Holy Tunic). The cathedral at Trier, Germany, claims to have the tunic -- Christ's seamless garment for which soldiers cast lots at the Crucifixion -- in its possession and said that it would be placed on exhibition from today through Sept. 19.

headline.main: NEWS OF THE WORLD OF STAMPS; West Germany Issues Stamp With Religious Significance
